definition: not stopping at anything/all manner of evil
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
(negative prefix)/not/no
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: Many people who lost their jobs during the Great Depression had to do whatever they could.
sentences.chinese: 许多人在大萧条中失去工作，迫于生计，无所不为。

sentences.english: Because it is "my computer to my stage" doing everything we can.
sentences.chinese: 因为这是“我的电脑我的舞台”我们可以无所不为。

sentences.english: Although her husband is as wicked as possible, she could do nothing but weep secretly all the time.
sentences.chinese: 丈夫吃喝嫖赌无所不为，她总是暗自垂泪却没有办法。

sentences.english: The greedy boss stopped at nothing to gain profit.
sentences.chinese: 贪心不足的老板为获取利润而无所不为。

sentences.english: Control. It's extraordinary the tactics people employ to obtain it.
sentences.chinese: 控制权，人们为了得到它真是无所不为。

sentences.english: The conquerors advanced,killing and plundering wherever they went.
sentences.chinese: 征服者一路上杀人越货无所不为。

sentences.english: It's extraordinary tactic people employ to obtain it.
sentences.chinese: 人们为了得到它真是无所不为。

definition: not to shrink from any crime (idiom); to commit any imaginable misdeed
to kill and burn (idiom); murder and arson
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
to oppress the people/to act tyrannically
to prey on the people
see 恣意妄為|恣意妄为[zi4 yi4 wang4 wei2]
to imitate the dog and steal chicken (idiom)/to pilfer/to dally with women/to have affairs
with no regard for law or discipline (idiom); flouting the law and disregarding all rules/in complete disorder
to torment the people (idiom)
regardless of the law and of natural morality (idiom); maverick/undisciplined and out of control
to flout the law
lit. strung through and filled with evil (idiom); filled with extreme evil/replete with vice/guilty of monstrous crimes
to have disregard for human life (idiom)
to become second nature/by nature
to swindle/to cheat
to kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
